Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: ANB456
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. Very clean and welcoming, The rooftop jaccuzi and sunbeds were lovely to strat the day with, although the water was cold (not heated jaccuzi), however, the hotel staff said the water would be a better temperature in the hotter months. We visited in August last year had an amazing time. weather was just right, could walk for miles without feeling lathargic and didn't really need a cardigan, even in the evening. The hotel was close to a metro station and was also close to a few popular tourist attractions. and lovely restaurants and clubs and bars too. It was very close to the centre of madrid and was easy to walk to all the close attractions. The room was lovely big, with a comfortable bed and enough room to snuggle and have your own space too!. there was a TV, more than enough cupboard space and a safe. The bathroom was luxurious and the shower could fit a whole group into it, it was also powerful and great to have a wash in. The hotel provided a comb, little soaps and a sewing kit too. There was a little fruit shop close by so I could get my daily dose of fruit and also plenty of cafe's and restaurants close by for breakfast lunch and dinner! Madrid is a lovely city and would love to go again. However we went to visit a friend and she found parking difficult round the hotel....but I don't think this took anything away from our fab stay at Catalonia Atocha. Was a little on the expensive side but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: vaishyv
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. This trip to Madrid was a surprise for my husband. He's quite fussy about hotels, and thought I would never find anything nice within my budget in expensive Madrid. I can across this hotel through venere, and loved the rooftop terrace, so went ahead with the booking. On arrival, I couldn't get over how lovely the hotel is. The staff were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. When we had problems getting football ticket, an employee came out of the hotel to the bank with to help resolve the problem - thank you. Location wise, Plaza Santa Ana was 10 mins walk away and become one of your favourite stops. The metro station was less than a minutes walk from the hotel, with only 2/3 stops from Gran Via and 1 stop from La Latina. Would happily stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Our new go-to hotel in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: DajomoNY
Reviews.Content: We happened upon this place by accident, but it gets perfect marks for location, price, cleanliness, service and design. We opted for a room with a huge balcony and a small separate living room (which I highly recommend) and had an incredibly restful long weekend sunning on the balcony and strolling the great nearby neighborhoods. The bathroom has very generous and a hairs stylist had no problem setting up shop and working on my wife's hair. Small Chinese-run odds-and-ends stores about 50m up the road has anything you might need, like power adapters, at reasonable prices. This is our new go-to hotel in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Modern/ Clean Rooms - good location”
Reviews.Author: Kellyjcook
Reviews.Content: Great location with a metro station 2 minutes walk away. Perfect to get to central or even walk 10-15 minutes. Superb rooms which are spacious with also a huge shower. Staff were very friendly and willing to help. free wifi. Dominos and kebab food places 2 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff and”
Reviews.Author: Faan10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights after being on business at Melia Castilla. I arrived and was checked into a smoking room which was very small. When calling reception they realised their mistake and upgraded us to a superior room with small terrace (non smoking). Good location to get to most of the historical sites. Room was clean and nice lay out. A big shower with enough space in the bathroom. We were charged more for breakfast through package deal than advertised at hotel so don't make the same mistake when booking. The roof terrace with sun beds and hot tub also looked in good condition even though we did not have enough time to make use of these

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tomana2009
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Catalonia Atocha two weeks ago, with some friends. I have to say we were very well treated by the staff (they even print our flight check in's with a smile). It's location is ideal to get what we wanted for a wekend trip: museums, El Retiro, shops, restaurants and cafetarias. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel. The rooms were quite nice and quiet (amazingly, no noise at all), although not enormous. We have got a nice price (for Madrid, of course), so it was a good value for money and a good choice from my friend.

Reviews.Title: “Junior suite - outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Rob V
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior Suite. The pictures looked nice, but the room is absolutely unbelievable!!! Very romantic! This gives you a taste of royalty during your stay. Decoration is beautiful with angels painted on the ceiling, gold painted decorations, fantastic bed, exceptional wooden floors and soooo spacious. We got the room at off-season price and per square meter this was surely the cheapest room in all Madrid. Service is at equal high standard. Treat yourself to an unbelievable stay and choose this suite, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Grinchey
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked to stay here for a 3 night city break after the owner of our previous accomodation cancelled our booking a week before our trip. We were surprised to find a central hotel for such an affordable price and I was slightly concerned things were too good to be true. But I can honestly say that we were far from disappointed and would, without hesitation, recommend this hotel and intend to return there on my next visit. The location is excellent-Anton Martin is the nearest Metro station and is really easy to use. You can get an unlimited 3 day travel pass for 13€ which I would recommend as its the best way to explore the city. However, the hotel is walking distance to the key tourist attractions of which Plaza Mayor and Retiro Park are absolutley worth a visit. Whilst the road isnt the nicest/quietest, our room was on the 1st floor but we didnt hear any noise during our stay. The facilities and standards at the hotel are exceptional. The rooms are cleaned daily to a very high standard and the showers are amazing! The hotel is contemporary and comfortable with excellent wifi. There are small fridges in the room,ideal for storing pate, meats and cheese which, accompanied by freshly baked bread from the bakery next door, makes for a delightful 'al fresco' lunch on the roof terrace. There are lovely views from the 7th floor terrace which is equipped wiv sunbeds, tables and chairs and a jacuzzi and it is perfect in the sun! The staff were really helpful and pleasant throughout our stay, particularly Noemi who was very accomodating. When I return to Madrid, Catalonia Atocha will be my first port of call!

Reviews.Title: “The best position. Next to key places in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Giuseppe V
Reviews.Content: Etremely well placed. Average 5 minutes walking from Museums and main monuments. Metro station very well connected. The hotel is fine but staff does not care too much about details: some negative marks for the strange smoke smell (like someone was smoking cigar next door); toilet clean but dusty. Modern premises without charm.

Reviews.Title: “Arrive by train, see the Prado, dine on Huertas”
Reviews.Author: MarinTravelDude
Reviews.Content: The Catalonia Atocha represents a great value in a GREAT location. It's walking distance to the Atocha Station, The Prado, and the fantastic spots on Huertas. I only gave the location 4 out of 5 because the street the hotel is on, Atocha, is very busy, chaotic and not super clean. But, because of that, the rates of this hotel are much lower (e.g. They were half of the perfectly located Me Hotel) than similar hotels a couple blocks away, closer to Huertas. The staff is friendly and attentive, the rooms are modern and nicely decorated, and the breakfast buffet was good: great variety and open til 11, which suited my teenagers very well. My only issue was that the beds are on wheels and tended to move around, especially when leaning against the headboard. I actually tried to lock the wheels to no avail. Anyway, I would certainly recommend this hotel and may stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent atention, excellent Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: Hi all, I had an outstanding experience on my christmas leave in Madrid from the very fisrst time I reached an agent. My girlfriend and I were very lucky being attended by Mrs. Noemi Martinez. We were always treated on a professional manner and folliwing her advice about sightseeing and classical tapas she made our Madrid experience even better. We found the meeting with her as a very valuabe lucky strike. I cant wait to visit the town again! AAA+++ Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: niki n
Reviews.Content: We were travelling in Europe and with a similar price tag, this hotel presented more value for money. It was well designed, clean, and close to attractions and metro. There is also a nice bakery just next to the hotel. Room size was not bad, the bathroom was big though. Overall it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Straveller75
Reviews.Content: I had actually booked to stay in Catalonia Cortes in calle del Prado, but that hotel had overbooked so I stayed in this hotel by default. I did give me a good reason for booking into a hotel in a chain as I didn't particularly relish walking the streets trying to find somewhere to stay if this had happened with another hotel. Having had this happen with this chain thought, not sure I would trust them again. However, the hotel was extremely comfortable having been newly refurbished. The room was probably one of the biggest I have had in Madrid and the shower was huge, marble and wonderful. The bed was hard, but not uncomfortably so and with some half decent pillows, which is a rarity. Breakfast was varied and fresh. Also, although on a busy road, it was one of the quietest rooms I have had in Madrid. My only problem with this hotel is its position. Although quite handy for virtually anywhere in old madrid or the station, including a couple of metro stations nearby, I find the calle Atocha my least favorite road. Noisy, dirty and fairly unattractive. Is all this outweighed by the hotel? Possibly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with some problems”
Reviews.Author: hugoolbpp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, clean and modern. It is very well located, "Antón Martín" metro station being almost in front of it. Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor are only two stations away. Atocha station (where you can take trains to every town in Spain) and Paseo del Prado are at walking distance - although one can hardly say Calle Atocha is a beautiful or pleasant street. But we had some problems. First of all, even though very polite, the staff gave us wrong information, which almost made us miss a flight (there are two stations with similar names, Atocha and Atocha Renfe, and the hotel employee told us the bus to the airport would depart from the wrong one). The safe did not open easily. We put our laptops inside it and could not take afterwards. It took us a long time to figure out the odd way the safe would open. Internet wifi was free, but it didn't work well. Some websites were blocked (like Gmail!!!!) and the connection was very slow. Finally, the main problem: the heating system was awful. Madrid was quite cold in December, and the blankets the hotel provided were not enough. It was a long night (we stayed there only one night). Maybe we could stay there again, but we would try to address these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Atocha”
Reviews.Author: Danilo M
Reviews.Content: Located in a very central area of Madrid, the Hotel Catalonia Atocha offers the possibility of having a very good service paired to a very competitive price. The rooms are very clean and the furniture is new with a very modern design. The best part of the Hotel is with no doubt the terrace at the 7th floor which offers a pool (only in summer), beds and tables. We had breakfast there and it was amazing! The personnel is very friendly and available 24/7. The Hotel is located only 10 mins walk from Puerta del sol and 5 mins from Plaza Mayor. The metro stop (Atocha) is about 200 m away from the entrance. The Park 'Buen Retiro' and 'Del Prado' museum can be reached as well on foot in 10-15 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience overall! Very Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Catalonia Atocha Hotel in Madrid for 5 nights during the new year period. We had a smoking room with a large balcony overlooking the street. The bathroom was clean and the shower was very relaxing. Would have preferred one double bed rather instead of two single beds put together since our request was specifically made for a double bed. Great Experience overall. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Bjorn_Toulose
Reviews.Content: As most of the reviews have said good location nice rooms modern and clean. The staff are helpfull. The breakfast buffet is ok but not worth 10 euro, a better option would be to strole in the direction of Plaza de Santa Anna and stop of at one of the numerous cafe/bars or burger king if you wish a big breakfast. Veiws from the hotel are limited because of the location of the hotel. street view or interior view.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: JNW2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in November. It is a very good location if you are going to be using the train station (a little walk up the hill from the station) as well as many of the other sites (e.g., Plaza Mayor, Plaza de Santa Ana, Prado, Reina Sofia, etc.). Staff was friendly and the rooms were clean and modern. Breakfast was not included in our booking, so I do not know about the food. Free wireless internet, which was good. Two minor downers were the staff forgot to leave towels one day and the heater/fan made clicking noises, which took awhile to get used to. Overall, a good experience and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: Alessandra M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HCAtocha with our daughter (6yrs old) during the long Xmas weekend and it truly was a beautiful experience. Our room had high frescoed ceiling, exquisitely decorated wooden floors, the grandest bed I have ever seen with a beautifully embroidered bedspread and 6 silken pillows. the bathroom too, was amazing: extremely clean with lots of soft and thick towels, a marble decorated floor, the biggest shower AND tub with torrents of hot water. we also had breakfast (10 euros each) where we were surprised to see that the richest, pantagruelic buffet was FREE for my daughter (6yrs and a good eater), a good change from Anglosaxon hotels. The buffet was positevely sumptuous. lastly, I would like to mention Axel, a receptionist whose admirable English really helped us to solve a difficult problem with such kindness and coutesy that you only wish to meet people like him. To sum up, the perfect place to stay in Madrid, and we are definetely going back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Fitchy_gent
Reviews.Content: This modern 4-star hotel is conveniently located between Atocha Station and Puerta del Sol. The interior of the hotel is new and comfortable. Likes: - free wireless internet available in public areas and hotel rooms - nice rain shower in the bathroom - great breakfast buffet, with a lot of variety (hot breakfast, fresh fruit, ....) - safe in hotel room

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Nyundungma
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel - recently opened with elegant and contemporary styling and incredibly helpful people working front and back of house. I am a frequent traveller and value that most essential of pleasures - a good shower at the end of a journey. This hotel delivers that - and so much more with an excellent location as well.

Reviews.Title: “High quality, big fun”
Reviews.Author: UnicoTrebbiano
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a weekend stay in Madrid. The guestrooms are fitted-out with great comfy beds & linen and ‘rain shower’. Add to this the sundeck @ rooftop level with whirlpool. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Niebes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean and the staff quite nice. Rooms are no big but modern and the bathroom is quite nice. The location is fine (10 minutes walk from Plazza Santa Ana and from 15 minutes Atocha station). The lobby is nice and quite. Just one remark, during breakfast there was very few tables availalbe not because there was to much people around, but because the staff was not cleaning the tables....which is strange since there was not much people around). In resume, phe price is very good for the hotel quality

Reviews.Title: “So Super Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: AuburnsKai
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Atocha was the least expensive of the hotels that we stayed at in the more cosmopolitan cities of Spain, but it was the most attractive one. It seems that it may be an under-known gem. Admittedly, we got a promotional rate, but the hotel's rating of 64 out of 457 hotels is really shocking, as we liked it more than the hotel that we had stayed at days earlier (though we also liked the first hotel), also in Madrid, which has a standing of number 8 out of the 457 hotels. The bedding at Catalonia Atocha was cozy and comfy. The decor was contemporary and chic. The hotel staff were approachable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Yenniva
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Our room was clean, modern and very comfortable and was such an amazing find for the price (76 euros per night). We ended up with a twin room as we booked last minute but the beds were huge and very comfortable so we didn't mind at all. A few people commented that the surrounding location is a little seedy but we had just come from another hotel on Gran Via (apparently "the" street to stay on in Madrid for some reason) and felt so much safer at Catalonia Atocha. The museums, shops, and Parque del Retiro are all just a short stroll away, as well as the Plaza de Santa Ana which has some fantastic restaurants. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “okay but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: jacqui k
Reviews.Content: Just camee back from 5 day stay at Catalonia Atocha little disappointed had booked a "Superior Terrace room" arrived late at night only to discover the hotel had down graded the room without warning!! after a lot of hassle they put us in a suite which was still not what I had booked as we were 3 adults and only had a double bed!! Eventually they reluctantly gave us a 3rd bed for the night. The following morning I went to reception to ask for the room I had booked and was told to come back at noon!!! We were only in Madrid for 5 days and I had not planned to spend my first day waiting around reception for a change of room, the receptionist was quite rude and said we should be grateful as we had been given a SUITE for the night!!! eventually at 3pm that day we got our room. once we were settled I had to go back to reception and enquire where the tea and coffee making facilities were in the room as advertised, the reception staff looked quite vague but eventually sent a kettle up to the room. Finally we were able to relax but it had been a bad start to our long awaited break and I found it frustrating that we were almost having to beg for something we had paid for. That night we decided to eat in the hotel restaurant and was more than satisfied we had a wonderful meal of Tapas, the following night after a long day sightseeing we decided again to eat in the hotel, my daughter ordered a burger which when it arrived was raw, we sent it back and half way through eating it discovered a hair in the coleslaw!! Myself and my mother had canneloni which was quite disgusting, I asked the waitress if they had changed the chef from the previous night as I did not feel we were eating in the same restaurant!!!! Finally on our last day we checked out of our room at 11:30am and decided to use the roof terrace for a spot of sunbathing before leaving for the airport, only to discover there was a private funtion on and the terrace was closed to hotel guests!!! i think this was the icing on the cake!!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel , horrible stuff- somthing was missed from my room”
Reviews.Author: lamiya1
Reviews.Content: i liked the hotel in general , good location very close to everything you need to see and pretty modern decore and clean .. they have nice roof top for after noon coffee .. the funny is that very nice beach bag was still in its plastic bag when it was missed from my room ( never happen before in 4 stars hotels history i guess) , i informed them and they said indirectly that i am not telling the truth heheheh .. anyway the stuff more or less were the dumbest unprofessional people i ever met in my life .. such a lose for a nice hotel i still love madrid

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, modern”
Reviews.Author: Progmom
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, museums are at walking distance, metro , Plaza Mayor, everything. The pillows where fantastic! The decor very modern but confortable. The breakfast buffet very well serverd with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Great location near train station, subway, and downtown”
Reviews.Author: RoamingAround
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, pretty modern, and had good wireless coverage. The location was ideal for our visit since we needed to take the AVE train to southern Spain (the train station was a 12 minute walk from the hotel, downhill). There is a Metro stop right outside of the hotel that is only two stops from Plaza Espania, which is the hub of the metro system and in the middle of old town. The value was great for the price. The only downside was the room we stayed in was a double but on the smallish side. But it was quiet and had several english language channels. I would stay there in a heartbeat if I am ever in Madrid again. Last note... We had breakfast on our last day since we needed to catch a train and didn't have time to go out. The breakfast was a 6 on a scale of 1 to 10 (10 being the highest). It wouldn't have been worth the cost everyday, but it will do if you need to eat and run.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good...”
Reviews.Author: Nprima
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine, only two small cons. Small room(1st floor) and no soundproof between rooms. I would only stay again because of attentive staff and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good but dont expect much”
Reviews.Author: Ren11
Reviews.Content: Location is ok. Aint the best in Madrid though Never saw more that 1 person working at the reception. Do better be patient upon check in and check out. Staff quite helpful though. Room: Had a room on the ground floor. Quite comfy but no daylight. Bathroom is a real disaster as shower is not closed and water spreads all over the floor. Quite smelly too. Big + is the free wifi

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel near everything!”
Reviews.Author: Kulan_78
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel near everything. It´s new and very nice. Nice beds. Nice roof-top terrace. Only 50m. to the nearest subway, Anton Martín. 5min walk to Retiro, 15min walk to Sol. I will look for a room here next time I go to Madrid. The only thing that I can´t recommend is the "Sports"-bar next to the reception, it´s better to go across the street.

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Atocha Calle Atocha 81
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Atocha 81, 28012 Madrid, Spain
